channel.title: Current bots (I'm a moron :))
channel.description:
This section seems to be nearly dead but I'm intrigued and it's been a long time since I've been up to date on the rs hacking scene.
[ul][li]It's surprising that people managed to get their updaters fixed so quickly after the nuke, the way people were talking about it sounded like they were done for good. How much of a setback was ClusterFlutterer? How hard was it to work around, and what was involved?[/li] [li]According to the RS Wiki, ClusterFlutterer was "partly removed from the game" on the 3rd of May, but "modifications to the game engine were put into affect to ensure that bots would remain broken". What were these modifications?[/li][/ul]

item.title: Current bots (I'm a moron :))

item.description:
@amfg wrote:

This section seems to be nearly dead but I’m intrigued and it’s been a long time since I’ve been up to date on the rs hacking scene.

[ul][li]It’s surprising that people managed to get their updaters fixed so quickly after the nuke, the way people were talking about it sounded like they were done for good. How much of a setback was ClusterFlutterer? How hard was it to work around, and what was involved?[/li]
[li]According to the RS Wiki, ClusterFlutterer was “partly removed from the game” on the 3rd of May, but “modifications to the game engine were put into affect to ensure that bots would remain broken”. What were these modifications?[/li][/ul]
